page.title: 18DISASTER IN ALVA
page.content:
On November 3rd 1984 very heavy rain brought{floods}to Alva. The last great floods were in 1877 when all the Hillfoots towns were affected. Here is part of a{ballad}written by Primary 6 after this{event. THE BALLAD OF THE GREAT ALVA FLOOD
The 3rd of November was not a good day No-one in Alva could go out to play, Down came the rain for hours & hours, With never a break between showers & showers.
At the West end of Alva folk suffered the worst The drains all filled up:they were ready to burst. The Back Road collapsed & the cars had to stop Workmen were pumping there all round the clock.
